title: Augusta: John Z. H. Rawlings to Alexander Brown, August 10, 1860
summary: John Z. H. Rawlings describes a recent trip to Staunton in this letter to Alexander Brown, a fellow student at the University of Virginia. During his visit, Rawlings accidentally jumped out of a window at a party and injured his leg. In addition to staying at the Cochran residence, Rawlings spent time at Variety Springs with a hotel keeper he calls Mr. Burrell but who appears in the Census as Charles Burress. Rawlings closes his letter by commanding his friend to attend the Democratic Convention.
